properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the policy. Must end with .aclpolicy.

properties.name: policy
properties.description: • policy - (Required) The name of the job, used to describe the job in the Rundeck UI.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the job, used to describe the job in the Rundeck UI.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Required) A longer description of the job, describing the job in the Rundeck UI.

properties.name: project_name
properties.description: • project_name - (Required) The name of the project that this job should belong to.

properties.name: execution_enabled
properties.description: • execution_enabled - (Optional) If you want job execution to be enabled or disabled. Defaults to true.

properties.name: group_name
properties.description: • group_name - (Optional) The name of a group within the project in which to place the job. Setting this creates collapsable subcategories within the Rundeck UI's project job index.

properties.name: log_level
properties.description: • log_level - (Optional) The log level that Rundeck should use for this job. Defaults to "INFO".

properties.name: schedule
properties.description: • schedule - (Optional) The jobs schedule in Unix crontab format

properties.name: schedule_enabled
properties.description: • schedule_enabled - (Optional) Sets the job schedule to be enabled or disabled. Defaults to true.

properties.name: allow_concurrent_executions
properties.description: • allow_concurrent_executions - (Optional) Boolean defining whether two or more executions of this job can run concurrently. The default is false, meaning that jobs will only run sequentially.

properties.name: max_thread_count
properties.description: • max_thread_count - (Optional) The maximum number of threads to use to execute this job, which controls on how many nodes the commands can be run simulateneously. Defaults to 1, meaning that the nodes will be visited sequentially.

properties.name: continue_on_error
properties.description: • continue_on_error - (Optional) Boolean defining whether Rundeck will continue to run subsequent steps if any intermediate step fails. Defaults to false, meaning that execution will stop and the execution will be considered to have failed.

properties.name: rank_attribute
properties.description: • rank_attribute - (Optional) The name of the attribute that will be used to decide in which order the nodes will be visited while executing the job across multiple nodes.

properties.name: rank_order
properties.description: • rank_order - (Optional) Keyword deciding which direction the nodes are sorted in terms of the chosen rank_attribute. May be either "ascending" (the default) or "descending".

properties.name: success_on_empty_node_filter
properties.description: • success_on_empty_node_filter - (Optional) Boolean determining if an empty node filter yields a successful result.

properties.name: preserve_options_order
properties.description: • preserve_options_order: (Optional) Boolean controlling whether the configured options will be presented in their configuration order when shown in the Rundeck UI. The default is false, which means that the options will be displayed in alphabetical order by name.

properties.name: command_ordering_strategy
properties.description: • command_ordering_strategy: (Optional) The name of the strategy used to describe how to traverse the matrix of nodes and commands. The default is "node-first", meaning that all commands will be executed on a single node before moving on to the next. May also be set to "step-first", meaning that a single step will be executed across all nodes before moving on to the next step.

properties.name: node_filter_query
properties.description: • node_filter_query - (Optional) A query string using Rundeck's node filter language that defines which subset of the project's nodes will be used to execute this job.

properties.name: node_filter_exclude_precedence
properties.description: • node_filter_exclude_precedence: (Optional) Boolean controlling a deprecated Rundeck feature that controls whether node exclusions take priority over inclusions.

properties.name: option
properties.description: • option: (Optional) Nested block defining an option a user may set when executing this job. A job may have any number of options. The structure of this nested block is described below.

properties.name: command
properties.description: • command: (Required) Nested block defining one step in the job workflow. A job must have one or more commands. The structure of this nested block is described below.

properties.name: notification
properties.description: • notification: (Optional) Nested block defining notifications on the job workflow. The structure of this nested block is described below.
option blocks have the following structure:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name: (Required) Unique name that will be shown in the UI when entering values and used as a variable name for template substitutions.

properties.name: default_value
properties.description: • default_value: (Optional) A default value for the option.

properties.name: value_choices
properties.description: • value_choices: (Optional) A list of strings giving a set of predefined values that the user may choose from when entering a value for the option.

properties.name: value_choices_url
properties.description: • value_choices_url: (Optional) Can be used instead of value_choices to cause Rundeck to obtain a list of choices dynamically by fetching this URL.

properties.name: require_predefined_choice
properties.description: • require_predefined_choice: (Optional) Boolean controlling whether the user is allowed to enter values not included in the predefined set of choices (false, the default) or whether a predefined choice is required (true).

properties.name: validation_regex
properties.description: • validation_regex: (Optional) A regular expression that a provided value must match in order to be accepted.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description: (Optional) A longer description of the option to be shown in the UI.

properties.name: required
properties.description: • required: (Optional) Boolean defining whether the user must provide a value for the option. Defaults to false.

properties.name: allow_multiple_values
properties.description: • allow_multiple_values: (Optional) Boolean defining whether the user may select multiple values from the set of predefined values. Defaults to false, meaning that the user may choose only one value.

properties.name: multi_value_delimiter
properties.description: • multi_value_delimiter: (Optional) Delimiter used to join together multiple values into a single string when allow_multiple_values is set and the user chooses multiple values.

properties.name: obscure_input
properties.description: • obscure_input: (Optional) Boolean controlling whether the value of this option should be obscured during entry and in execution logs. Defaults to false, but should be set to true when the requested value is a password, private key or any other secret value.

properties.name: exposed_to_scripts
properties.description: • exposed_to_scripts: (Optional) Boolean controlling whether the value of this option is available to scripts executed by job commands. Defaults to false.
command blocks must have any one of the following combinations of arguments as contents:

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description: (Optional) gives a description to the command block.

properties.name: shell_command
properties.description: • shell_command gives a single shell command to execute on the nodes.

properties.name: inline_script
properties.description: • inline_script gives a whole shell script, inline in the configuration, to execute on the nodes.

properties.name: script_file
properties.description: • script_file and script_file_args together describe a script that is already pre-installed on the nodes which is to be executed.

properties.name: job
properties.description: • A job block, described below, causes another job within the same project to be executed as a command.

properties.name: step_plugin
properties.description: • A step_plugin block, described below, causes a step plugin to be executed as a command.

properties.name: node_step_plugin
properties.description: • A node_step_plugin block, described below, causes a node step plugin to be executed once for each node.
A command's job block has the following structure:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name: (Required) The name of the job to execute. The target job must be in the same project as the current job.

properties.name: group_name
properties.description: • group_name: (Optional) The name of the group that the target job belongs to, if any.

properties.name: run_for_each_node
properties.description: • run_for_each_node: (Optional) Boolean controlling whether the job is run only once (false, the default) or whether it is run once for each node (true).

properties.name: args
properties.description: • args: (Optional) A string giving the arguments to pass to the target job, using Rundeck's job arguments syntax.

properties.name: nodefilters
properties.description: • nodefilters: (Optional) A map for overriding the referenced job's node filters.
A command's nodefilters block has the following structure:

properties.name: excludeprecedence
properties.description: • excludeprecedence: (Optional) Whether to exclude precedence or not.

properties.name: filter
properties.description: • filter: (Optional) The node filter query string to use.
A command's step_plugin or node_step_plugin block both have the following structure:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type: (Required) The name of the plugin to execute.

properties.name: config
properties.description: • config: (Optional) Map of arbitrary configuration parameters for the selected plugin.
notification blocks have the following structure:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type: (Required) The name of the type of notification. Can be of type on_success, on_failure, on_start.

properties.name: email
properties.description: • email: (Optional) block listed below to send emails as notificiation.

properties.name: webhook_urls
properties.description: • webhook_urls: (Optional) A list of urls to send a webhook notification.

properties.name: plugin
properties.description: • plugin: (Optional) A block listed below to send notifications using a plugin.
A notification's email block has the following structure:

properties.name: attach_log
properties.description: • attach_log: (Optional) A boolean to attach log to email or not. Defaults to false.

properties.name: recipients
properties.description: • recipients: (Required) A list of recipients to receive email.

properties.name: subject
properties.description: • subject: (Optional) Name of email subject.
A notification's plugin block has the following structure:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The name of the plugin to use.

properties.name: config
properties.description: • config - (Required) Map of arbitrary configuration properties for the selected plugin.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the project, used both in the UI and to uniquely identify the project. Must therefore be unique across a single Rundeck installation.

properties.name: resource_model_source
properties.description: • resource_model_source - (Required) Nested block instructing Rundeck on how to determine the set of resources (nodes) for this project. The nested block structure is described below.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the project, to be displayed in the Rundeck UI. Defaults to "Managed by Terraform".

properties.name: default_node_file_copier_plugin
properties.description: • default_node_file_copier_plugin - (Optional) The name of a plugin to use to copy files onto nodes within this project. Defaults to jsch-scp, which uses the "Secure Copy" protocol to send files over SSH.

properties.name: default_node_executor_plugin
properties.description: • default_node_executor_plugin - (Optional) The name of a plugin to use to run commands on nodes within this project. Defaults to jsch-ssh, which uses the SSH protocol to access the nodes.

properties.name: ssh_authentication_type
properties.description: • ssh_authentication_type - (Optional) When the SSH-based file copier and executor plugins are used, the type of SSH authentication to use. Defaults to privateKey.

properties.name: ssh_key_storage_path
properties.description: • ssh_key_storage_path - (Optional) When the SSH-based file copier and executor plugins are used, the location within Rundeck's key store where the SSH private key can be found. Private keys can be uploaded to rundeck using the rundeck_private_key resource.

properties.name: ssh_key_file_path
properties.description: • ssh_key_file_path - (Optional) Like ssh_key_storage_path except that the key is read from the Rundeck server's local filesystem, rather than from the key store.

properties.name: extra_config
properties.description: • extra_config - (Optional) Behind the scenes a Rundeck project is really an arbitrary set of key/value pairs. This map argument allows setting any configuration properties that aren't explicitly supported by the other arguments described above, but due to limitations of Terraform the key names must be written with slashes in place of dots. Do not use this argument to set properties that the above arguments set, or undefined behavior will result.
resource_model_source blocks have the following nested arguments:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The name of the resource model plugin to use.

properties.name: config
properties.description: • config - (Required) Map of arbitrary configuration properties for the selected resource model plugin.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (Required) The path within the key store where the key will be stored.

properties.name: key_material
properties.description: • key_material - (Required) The private key material to store, serialized in any way that is accepted by OpenSSH.
The key material is hashed before it is stored in the state file, so sharing the resulting state will not disclose the private key contents.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: delete
properties.description: • delete - (Computed) True if the key should be deleted when the resource is deleted. Defaults to true if key_material is provided in the configuration.

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (Required) The path within the key store where the key will be stored. By convention this path name normally ends with ".pub" and otherwise has the same name as the associated private key.

properties.name: key_material
properties.description: • key_material - (Optional) The public key string to store, serialized in any way that is accepted by OpenSSH. If this is not included, key_material becomes an attribute that can be used to read the already-existing key material in the Rundeck store.

The key material is included inline as a string, which is consistent with the way a public key is provided to the aws_key_pair, cloudstack_ssh_keypair, digitalocean_ssh_key and openstack_compute_keypair_v2 resources. This means the key_material argument can be populated from the interpolation of the public_key attribute of such a keypair resource, or vice-versa.
